snippet: A government decision to open wheat and barley export sales has set off competition by companies worldwide looking for a piece of the Canadian market.
abstract: Announcement of possible acquisition of Viterra, Canada's largest grain handling and marketing firm, prompts investor interest and may lead to political controversy; statement comes after decision by Canadian government to end its 76-year-old monopoly and open wheat and barley export sales.
lead_paragraph: A government decision to open wheat and barley export sales has set off competition by companies worldwide looking for a piece of the Canadian market.

headline.seo: Bid for Viterra Sets Up Political Fight in Canada
headline.main: Bid for Grain Operator in Canada Sets Up Fight
headline.print_headline: Bid for Grain Operator In Canada Sets Up Fight
